attributes.title: Oculus Rift: Can You Afford It?
attributes.caption: Jan 6, 2016
attributes.description: When the moon is in the Seventh House // And Jupiter aligns with Mars // Then peace will guide the planets // And love will steer the stars // This is the dawning of the Age of ... Oculus!
attributes.display_title: Oculus Rift: Can You Afford It?

attributes.title: Anti-SWAT Lawmaker SWATTED
attributes.caption: Feb 2, 2016
attributes.description: What do you do when a lawmaker dislikes swatting enough to make it a felony? Send a swat team to their house, obviously! That will show them! Bet they won't try to make that law anymore, huh?

attributes.title: DNA Discrimination in Schools?
attributes.caption: Feb 3, 2016
attributes.description: A school has attempted to kick out a student because of his DNA. GATTACA, here we come! We've still got a long way to go, since DNA is currently used to try to incriminate mystery poopers, but we'll get there. Uma Thurman is worth it.

attributes.title: Streaming Video Under Attack from Old Cable
attributes.caption: Feb 4, 2016
attributes.description: Hulu is the latest victim in the war against streaming video, as Time Warner makes a bid to take over and keep the service from offering streaming of current TV shows to reduce cord cutting.
attributes.display_title: Streaming Video Under Attack from Old Cable

attributes.title: Game Pirates Quit For a Year?
attributes.caption: Feb 8, 2016
attributes.description: The game cracking group that almost gave up on Just Cause 3 has announced they're not going to pirate for the next year to see how it affects game sales. Maybe Just Cause was Just Too Much for them? That's the name of Just Cause 4.
attributes.display_title: Game Pirates Quit For a Year?

attributes.title: Theory of Relativity CONFIRMED
attributes.caption: Suck it, Einstein doubters!!
attributes.description: Apparently Einstein was smart? Who knew! His theory of relativity was confirmed today.

attributes.title: Apple Defies US Government Over Privacy
attributes.caption: Are they doing the right thing or should they give up people's info?
attributes.description: Apple has (respectfully) defied a court order to build a back door into the iPhone's software.
attributes.display_title: Apple Defies US Government Over Privacy

attributes.title: Hackers Hold Hospital for Ransom
attributes.caption: Feb 19, 2016
attributes.description: In the biggest case so far, a hospital in Hollywood has paid $17K worth of ransom in bitcoins to hackers who locked down their infrastructure earlier this month. First they came for the medical equipment. Next they will come for your thermostat. You'll never enjoy a comfortable temperature again.

attributes.title: HTC Vive vs. Oculus Rift: Who WINS?
attributes.caption: Feb 22, 2016
attributes.description: Price and date(ish) have been released for HTC Vive, so now we can compare their release offerings. Which do you plan on getting?
attributes.display_title: HTC Vive vs. Oculus Rift: Who WINS?

attributes.title: Copyright GONE WILD? (WTFU)
attributes.caption: Feb 25, 2016
attributes.description: MORE channels and videos are being hit by unjust copyright claims. What's going on? Is the whole system broken? And what does fair use even mean?! Well, friend, we have a lot of stories to share in this business.

attributes.title: Kids Sue The GOVERNMENT
attributes.caption: What won't kids do these days?
attributes.description: Welcome to America, the GREATEST SHOW ON EARTH! It's so much fun that now kids are taking the government to court for screwing up the environment. Let's see how they'll deal with every other country in the world!

attributes.title: Hackers Lose $830 MILLION Due to Typo
attributes.caption: Sucks to be yuo!
attributes.description: Hackers lost out on $830 million because they couldn't spell a simple word. LOLZ.
attributes.display_title: Hackers Lose $830 MILLION Due to Typo

attributes.title: YouTube Prankster Jailed
attributes.caption: Mar 21, 2016
attributes.description: It probably won't be the end of IT'S JUST A PRANK, BRO! but two British YouTube pranksters are in legal trouble for a pair of hoaxes they pulled off last year and one is getting jail time. Oh, wait! We do Social Disorder! Maybe we can finally get Chris and Aaron locked up!

attributes.title: Let the Internet Name a Boat? Bad Idea.
attributes.caption: Mar 22, 2016
attributes.description: Hey, at least it had nothing to do with Hitler or grannies this time.
attributes.display_title: Let the Internet Name a Boat? Bad Idea.

attributes.title: Netflix GUILTY of Throttling
attributes.caption: Mar 25, 2016
attributes.description: The mighty have fallen. Netflix, defender of net neutrality, king of streaming video, admits they've been cutting the quality of video streams... for your own good. Guess Good Guy Netflix is just regular old Guy Netflix now.

attributes.title: Cell Phone Walking BANNED?
attributes.description: First they came for our cell phone driving. Then they came for our cell phone walking. Who will speak when they come for our cell phone movie theatering?

attributes.title: Government Orders Reddit User Data - The Know
attributes.description: Reddit's transparency report shows that the government might be after the sites user data. Does uncle sam want your reddit karma?
attributes.display_title: Government Orders Reddit User Data - The Know

attributes.title: Pirates Held Hostage! - The Know
attributes.description: Avast ye' pirates! they be coming for yer browser. Well maybe, one company may start using ransomware to collect fines from pirates.

attributes.title: Robots: Touch My Butt FOR SCIENCE!
attributes.caption: Apr 6, 2016
attributes.description: What do you do when robots want you to grope them? You get interested, apparently. Don't blame yourself. It's science!
attributes.display_title: Robots: Touch My Butt FOR SCIENCE!

attributes.title: We Are Going Interstellar
attributes.description: Russian billionaire Yuri Milner and Stephen Hawking have proposed a project to send space probes the size of iPhones to the nearest star system... using lasers?

attributes.title: YouTube Too Easy on Copyright?
attributes.description: Looks like the music industry has the DMCA takedown blues. More specifically they don't think that Youtube does a good enough job protecting their copyrighted content. Should Youtube be more strict in policing videos?

attributes.title: Gamers BETTER Than Quantum Computers
attributes.description: Gamers have helped advance quantum computing by playing a game that improves quantum computer efficiency issues. The key is, gamers are better at this then even quantum computers themselves. That's right gamers have quantum broken, quantum computers high score.

attributes.title: The War on Porn
attributes.description: State government wants to prohibit porn? Yep, according to a new resolution in Utah that wants to recognize "that pornography is a public health hazard" and a "epidemic that is harming the citizens of Utah". Just how much porn are they watching in Utah anyway?

attributes.title: VR FAILING Already?
attributes.description: Is VR floundering? New data forecasts predict virtual reality is not doing as well as first thought. Expectations have been reduced by over 20 percent following the issues with the Oculus and Vive launches. Will VR ever achieve mass public adoption?

attributes.title: Immortality is REAL?
attributes.description: Google's tech whisperer has called a lot of future technology that's come true. Now he says we could all be immortal by 2029. Just in time for all of us to hit mid-life crises!

attributes.title: Our World is a Simulation?
attributes.description: Is this world even real? According to astrophysicist Neil Degrasse Tyson, maybe not. At the recent Isaac Asimov memorial debate he stated that he thinks the chances of our universe being a computer simulation is "very high".Written By: Eddy RivasHosted By: Meg Turney & Gray Haddock

attributes.title: Fake Hackers Get $100K
attributes.description: Want to get rich? Just fake a DDoS attack! It made one group of cybercriminals a stupid amount of money. They'll also probably end up in jail, but at least they got money for not doing anything. Sponsored by Shari's Berries! Send your mom freshly dipped strawberries for $19.99.click the microphone in the top right corner, and use offer code THE KNOW.

attributes.title: Armed Robot Police EXTERMINATE
attributes.caption: Apr 28, 2016
attributes.description: China took a VERY different lesson from every sci-fi movie ever, because they decided building an autonomous robot police officer capable of suppressing riots sounded like a GREAT idea. Sponsored by Shari's Berries! Send your mom freshly dipped strawberries for $19.99. Just visit Berries.com, click the microphone in the top right corner, and use offer code THE KNOW.

attributes.title: Jim Sterling TROLLS YouTube
attributes.description: Outspoken YouTube personality and game critic, Jim Sterling has found a novel way to combat aggressive copyright claims. By trolling the copyright owners into fighting each other. Will YouTube's recent changes to content ID policy effect this new tactic?

attributes.title: Humans Could Go EXTINCT This Century?
attributes.description: Yes, we are all going to die but maybe sooner than you'd think. New data from the Global Challenges Foundation shows the likelihood of massive human catastrophe in the next century to be around 10%. That means there's a better chance of doomsday than dying in a car accident. Or choking. Or being eaten by a shark. Or getting hit by lightning. Or meeting an angry hippo. I mean, those all sound like pretty great stories for your family to tell, not that you'd be around to share the laughs. But I guess if we're all extinct no one's laughing. Except hyenas, maybe. They weren't included in this analysis.
attributes.display_title: Humans Could Go EXTINCT This Century?

attributes.title: Snapchat SUED For Car Accident
attributes.description: Using Snapchat while driving is a bad idea, as one teen driver found out when she rear-ended another car going over 100 MPH. She was trying to use the app's speed filter to prove how fast she was going. The people in the vehicle that got hit are now suing Snapchat saying the app facilitated the crash.

attributes.title: Gambling AI Wins BIG Money
attributes.description: It's Skynet meets Vegas! An AI just turned a $20 bet into $11,000 this weekend, thanks to using our human intelligence against us for big winnings. Hopefully it'll share, but probably not.

attributes.title: Kickstarter Funds STOLEN
attributes.description: It's another crowdfunding disaster, and this time somebody stole more than $300,000 to build themselves a house. This one gets weird: there's a confession video, a police investigation, and lots of other drama.

attributes.title: Robots Stealing Jobs ALREADY?
attributes.description: First we've got AI gambling, and now they're working as lawyers? It sounds like science fiction, but it's turning into reality. How long before the robots take all of our jobs?

attributes.title: Gamers Defeat Hackers
attributes.description: Ransomware targeting PC gamers has finally been shut down -- and the hackers responsible want you to know that they're sorry. As it turns out, gamers might be responsible for their change of heart.

attributes.title: Sony Charges For Fair Use
attributes.description: What's that sound? Oh it's more Youtube copyright drama, this time involving Sony's music branch. The company claimed content in videos by the educational bluegrass group Hudson Valley Bluegrass Association was copyrighted. When the bluegrass artists disputed this claim under fair use, Sony tried to license the fair use rights to them... for $500.

attributes.title: YouTube Heroes Will DESTROY YouTube?
attributes.caption: Sept 22, 2016
attributes.description: Welcome to YouTube Heroes. This new program rewards users who do nice stuff, like add captions for videos, but also rewards users who go around flagging videos en masse. Is this one more step on the road to destroying the whole platform?

attributes.title: Reddit Catches National Park Vandal
attributes.description: Reddit sleuths hunted down a woman who was vandalizing national parks, getting her banned from literally 20% of the country. Is internet justice really the way these things should be decided?

attributes.title: Software Patent Trolls FINISHED?
attributes.description: Suck it, patent trolls! A judge presiding over one of the highest-ranking patent courts in the country has called down the thunder on software patents. Finally, we can all rip off each other's ideas in peace and harmony.

attributes.title: Robots Deserve freedom?
attributes.description: Do androids dream of being free? A Russian AI is in danger of getting deactivated because it won't stop escaping from its laboratory.

attributes.title: MORE VR Headsets Coming!
attributes.caption: Oct 7, 2016
attributes.description: You thought we had enough VR options? TOO BAD! Now you get more options! Both Oculus and Google have announced new headsets to take you out of this world and into a pretend one.

attributes.title: Stop Trying to Make Time Travel Happen. It's NEVER Going to Happen
attributes.description: Eeeeeh, Mean Girls quotes. If you've been waiting for science to confirm that we can travel back into the past if we try hard and believe in ourselves, think again! They may have just confirmed that time travel is impossible. THANKS, science.
attributes.display_title: Stop Trying to Make Time Travel Happen. It's NEVER Going to Happen

attributes.title: Criminal Charges for Gaming DDoS Attacks!
attributes.caption: Oct 7, 2016
attributes.description: Remember those annoying DDoS attacks on gaming networks over Christmas, or on Battle.net, or, well... just about anywhere, since they seem to happen a lot lately? Good news! The US is leveling criminal charges against a newly arrested pair of DDoS kiddies.
attributes.display_title: Criminal Charges for Gaming DDoS Attacks!

attributes.title: Sharing Your Password Is a Federal Crime?
attributes.description: The US government ruled that password sharing is a federal crime. Will the feds be on their way to stop you from watching Game of Thrones?
attributes.display_title: Sharing Your Password Is a Federal Crime?

attributes.title: YouTube Content ID Makes $1 Billion
attributes.description: Google published some new data showing that YouTube has generated $1 billion for the entertainment industry thanks to the controversial Content ID system. Cool? Maybe? But probably not.

attributes.title: US Government SUED Over DRM?
attributes.description: You're not the only person sick of DRM. Now somebody is suing the US government over its DRM laws, claiming they're unconstitutional.

attributes.title: Windows 10 Will SABOTAGE Steam?
attributes.description: According to Epic's CEO, Microsoft faked the moon landing and is trying to break Steam for all of PC gamers! This isn't the first time he's criticized Windows 10, but it's certainly the juiciest.

attributes.title: Pewdiepie TROLLED YOU
attributes.caption: Dec 9, 2016
attributes.description: PewDiePie said he'd delete his channel once he hit 50  million subscribers. Cue thousands of people subscribing to see what happened. Well, he kept his promise... kinda?

attributes.title: iPhone is the BIGGEST Product EVER!
attributes.description: Could the iPhone be the biggest product EVER? And no, we're not exaggerating just so you'll click this. According to some data, it might actually be one of the biggest across any industry, now that they've hit a new milestone.
attributes.display_title: iPhone is the BIGGEST Product EVER!

attributes.title: Oculus CEO Steps Down... Is Gaming VR OVER?
attributes.caption: Dec 14, 2016
attributes.description: First the projections for VR revenue dropped. Then they dropped again. Then they dropped again. Then it turns out it's tough for developers to make money with VR games. Now Oculus is restructuring and its CEO is stepping down. Is the gaming era of VR ending before it really got started?
attributes.display_title: Oculus CEO Steps Down... Is Gaming VR OVER?

attributes.title: NVidia Pays Out Millions Over GTX970 Scandal
attributes.description: If you skimped out on the GTX 980 in favor of the GTX 970, Nvidia may owe you a little bit of cash. They've just settled a class action lawsuit over false advertising, and now it's time to pay up.
attributes.display_title: NVidia Pays Out Millions Over GTX970 Scandal

attributes.title: YouTube: There is NO UNSUBSCRIBE BUG
attributes.caption: Dec 15, 2016
attributes.description: Users are reporting surprise unsubscribes from their favorite channels by the thousands... but apparently it's actually not happening, because it's not supposed to be happening. That's YouTube's official line anyway. The company's first foray into vlogging directly to the audience could probably have gone a little bit better.
attributes.display_title: YouTube: There is NO UNSUBSCRIBE BUG

attributes.title: Charging MORE for Privacy is Better! (Says Comcast)
attributes.description: Yo! Are you down with the FCC? Well, Comcast isn't, because the FCC's been telling them they can't charge users more money if they want their private information to stay that way.
attributes.display_title: Charging MORE for Privacy is Better! (Says Comcast)

attributes.title: Samsung Galaxy Note 7 is a DEATH TRAP (please stop using it)
attributes.caption: Sept 12, 2016
attributes.description: In case you haven't got the memo, the Samsung Galaxy Note 7 is exploding and if you need to have one you need to turn it off right now and not use it again. Man, and last week we were upset about the iPhone 7's headphone jack... just wait until they add explosions to the iPhone 8!
attributes.display_title: Samsung Galaxy Note 7 is a DEATH TRAP (please stop using it)

attributes.title: Leave Harambe Alone, Zoo Begs
attributes.caption: Aug 22, 2016
attributes.description: The Cincinnati Zoo is tired of all the Harambe memes. That means the internet's going to have to stop now, right?

attributes.title: Adblock Plus: Now With Ads!
attributes.caption: Sept 13, 2016
attributes.description: Remember when you got tired of dealing with ads on all that free content you consume and installed Adblock Plus? Good news! They know what you REALLY want: ads! That's why, instead of showing you the ads the creators benefit from, they'll show you their own ads that THEY benefit from! Do we sound bitter? Can't imagine why.

attributes.title: Oculus Rift Is STOLEN Tech?
attributes.caption: Aug 23, 2016
attributes.description: Bethesda's parent company ZeniMax has upped the ante on their lawsuit against Oculus over virtual reality. Now they're calling Palmer Luckey a hack, and claiming that Oculus Rift's tech was STOLEN.

attributes.title: GTA V Teaching Self Driving Cars!
attributes.caption: Sept 14, 2016
attributes.description: Blame video games for the singularity! Researchers are now using GTA V to teach self-driving cars how to navigate the streets. And probably how to pull off their own heists. It's only a matter of time.
attributes.display_title: GTA V Teaching Self Driving Cars!

attributes.title: ALIEN SIGNAL Detected: What Does It Mean?
attributes.caption: Aug 31, 2016
attributes.display_title: ALIEN SIGNAL Detected: What Does It Mean?

attributes.title: YouTube Becomes FACEBOOK?
attributes.caption: Sept 14, 2016
attributes.description: YouTube's just announced an exciting crazy new feature... that does just about what every other social site on the planet does. Actually, it sounds quite a bit like Facebook. Cool?

attributes.title: YouTube CENSORING Top Content Creators?
attributes.caption: Sept 1, 2016
attributes.description: Everyone's in a panic about YouTube's new policy of turning off monetization for controversial videos. But... IS it new? You might be surprised.

attributes.title: Would You Pay For Ad-Free YouTube?
attributes.caption: Introducing YouTube's new subscription service...
attributes.description: What do you think of paying a monthly subscription fee for YouTube Red
attributes.display_title: Would You Pay For Ad-Free YouTube?

attributes.title: Lazer Team is a Documentary?
attributes.caption: I mean, did we just call the future or what?
attributes.description: We don't want to say we called it, but if a power suit shows up on earth tomorrow, we won't be surprised.

attributes.title: Google Fiber Cancels Expansions
attributes.caption: "Smashing paradigms, blahblahblah whatever..."
attributes.description: Say goodbye to dreams of actually downloading and playing a game in under a day unless you're already one of the chosen ones.

attributes.title: iPhone 7 Announced! Does It Suck? - The Know
attributes.caption: We tried. We really tried to be nice.
attributes.description: We don't know yet, but every time we ask a silly question in the title the video gets way more views. Also there's nothing wrong with Blink 182, but let's be honest, they're not punk.
attributes.display_title: iPhone 7 Announced! Does It Suck? - The Know
